metadata.Title: CVE-2014-6428 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The dissect_spdu function in epan/dissectors/packet-ses.c in the SESdissector in Wireshark 1.10.x before 1.10.10 and 1.12.x before 1.12.1 doesnot initialize a certain ID value, which allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (application crash) via a crafted packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-6428` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwireshark10 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwiretap7 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwscodecs1 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwsutil8 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
tshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-common - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-gtk - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-qt - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12.1+g01b65bf-2').
